intro: Vanzijlia angustipetala, commonly known as the narrow-petalled vanzijlia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers with five lobed petals. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Vanzijlia angustipetala is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
